item.title: 消息人士称，OpenAI 将采用谷歌的人工智能芯片为其产品提供动力
item.description: 此举标志着 OpenAI 首次有意义地使用非英伟达芯片，也表明该公司不再依赖微软的数据中心。【原文：The move signals the first time OpenAI has used non-Nvidia chips meaningfully and shows the company's shift away from relying on Microsoft's data centers.】

item.title: 加拿大取消数字服务税以推进与美国的贸易谈判
item.description: 加拿大财政部在周日的一份声明中表示，加拿大已经取消了数字服务税，以推进与美国的贸易谈判。【原文：Canada has rescinded its digital services tax in a bid to advance trade negotiations with the U.S., Canada's finance ministry said in a statement on Sunday.】

item.title: 中国蚂蚁金服集团 2024 年研发投入 32.6 亿美元
item.description: 中国金融科技公司蚂蚁金服集团周一表示，自2021年以来，该公司已连续四年增加研发（R&D）投资，2024年将达到234.5亿元人民币（32.6亿美元）的历史新高。【原文：Chinese financial technology firm Ant Group said on Monday that it has increased investment in research and development (R&D) for four consecutive years since 2021, reaching a record high of 23.45 billion yuan ($3.26 billion) in 2024.】

item.title: 对美国贸易协议的乐观情绪推动美联储宽松政策押注，美元下跌
item.description: 美元兑欧元周一跌至近四年来的最低点附近，原因是市场对美国贸易协议的乐观情绪增强了对美联储提前降息的押注。【原文：The dollar wallowed near its lowest in nearly four years against the euro on Monday as market optimism over U.S. trade deals bolstered bets for earlier Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 上半年全球并购交易规模扩大，银行家对巨额交易表现出浓厚兴趣
item.description: 今年上半年的并购活动并不如投资银行家们所期望的那样，但亚洲大宗交易的爆发和美国市场重新恢复的乐观情绪可能会为巨额交易铺平道路。【原文：Mergers and acquisitions during the first half of this year were not what investment bankers had hoped for, but a burst of big deals in Asia and renewed optimism in U.S. markets could be paving the way for megadeals.】

item.title: 欧佩克+供应增加，中东风险缓解，石油价格下跌
item.description: 由于中东地缘政治风险缓解以及欧佩克+8月份再次增产的前景提振了供应前景，周一油价下跌了1%。【原文：Oil prices fell 1% on Monday as an easing of geopolitical risks in the Middle East and the prospect of another OPEC+ output hike in August boosted the supply outlook.】

item.title: 亚洲股市在薪资测试前追随华尔街涨势
item.description: 周一，亚洲股市走强，因为对科技公司似乎无止境的需求使 S&P 500 指数期货再创历史新高。【原文：Asia shares firmed on Monday as seemingly unquenchable demand for technology companies lifted S&P 500 futures to another all-time peak, while the dollar dipped on concerns U.S. jobs data will show enough weakness to justify larger rate cuts.】

item.title: 特朗普告诉福克斯新闻，日本汽车贸易 "不公平"，可能会购买更多美国石油
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在周日播出的一次采访中表示，日本与美国进行着 "不公平 "的汽车贸易，日本应该增加对美国能源资源和其他商品的进口，以帮助减少美国的贸易赤字。【原文：Japan engages in "unfair" automobile trade with the United States and should increase its imports of U.S. energy resources and other goods to help reduce the U.S. trade deficit, President Donald Trump said in an interview broadcast on Sunday.】

item.title: 劳埃德称英国企业信心水平创 2015 年以来新高
item.description: 周一公布的一项调查显示，由于企业对经济前景更加乐观，英国雇主的信心水平在本月创下了九年来的新高。【原文：Confidence levels among British employers hit a fresh nine-year high this month as companies became more optimistic about the outlook for the economy, according to a survey published on Monday.】

item.title: 美国参议院推进特朗普减税计划，非党派分析提高了价格标签
item.description: 一家无党派预测机构周日表示，美国参议院版本的总统唐纳德-特朗普的全面减税和支出法案将使美国债务增加 3.3 万亿美元，比众议院上个月通过的版本多出约 8000 亿美元。【原文：The U.S. Senate version of President Donald Trump's sweeping tax-cut and spending bill will add $3.3 trillion to the nation's debt, about $800 billion more than the version passed last month by the House of Representatives, a nonpartisan forecaster said on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普告诉福克斯新闻：美加贸易谈判在某些税项被取消前停止
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在周日播出的采访中表示，美国与加拿大的贸易谈判将停止，"直到他们放弃某些税收为止"。【原文：U.S. trade talks with Canada will be stopped "until such time as they drop certain taxes," President Donald Trump said in an interview broadcast on Sunday.】

item.title: 特朗普在接受福克斯采访时说，他有一群有钱人要收购 TikTok
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在周日播出的采访中说，他已经为 TikTok 找到了一个买家，是一群 "非常富有的人"，他将在两周后透露这些人的身份。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said in an interview broadcast on Sunday that he had found a buyer for TikTok, a group of "very wealthy people" who he will reveal in about two weeks.】

item.title: 报告称贸易风险将使澳大利亚资源收益持续缩水
item.description: 一份政府报告周一称，由于贸易壁垒风险上升、大宗商品价格下跌以及全球经济疲软，澳大利亚的矿业和能源出口收入预计将在未来两年继续下滑。【原文：Australia's mining and energy export earnings are expected to continue to slide over the next two years due to elevated risks of trade barriers, falling bulk commodity prices and a weak global economy, a government report said on Monday.】

item.title: 德国寻求与以色列合作进行网络防御，计划建造 "网络穹顶
item.description: 德国内政部长亚历山大-多布林特（Alexander Dobrindt）周日表示，德国正致力于建立一个德以联合网络研究中心，并深化两国情报和安全机构之间的合作。【原文：Germany is aiming to establish a joint German-Israeli cyber research centre and deepen collaboration between the two countries' intelligence and security agencies, German Interior Minister Alexander Dobrindt said on Sunday.】

item.title: 法国部长呼吁延长欧盟与美国的贸易谈判
item.description: 法国财政部长呼吁将欧盟与美国的贸易谈判延长至 7 月 9 日最后期限之后，以确保达成更好的协议。【原文：France's finance minister has called for extending EU-U.S. trade talks beyond the July 9 deadline in order to secure a better agreement.】

item.title: 国际清算银行（BIS）称世界经济面临 "关键时刻
item.description: 央行伞式机构国际清算银行（Bank for International Settlements）在其对世界经济状况的最新评估中表示，贸易紧张局势和地缘政治纷争有可能暴露出全球金融体系中的深层断层。【原文：Trade tensions and fractious geopolitics risk exposing deep fault lines in the global financial system, central bank umbrella body the Bank for International Settlements, said in its latest assessment of the state of the world economy.】

item.title: 印尼官员称中国锂电池厂将于 2026 年底投入运营
item.description: 印尼官员周日表示，印尼一家公司与中国 CATL 合作的锂离子电池厂预计将于 2026 年底投入运营，初期产能为 6.9 千兆瓦时。【原文：A lithium-ion battery plant by an Indonesian company and China's CATL is expected to be in operation by the end of 2026 with initial capacity of 6.9 gigawatt hours, an Indonesian official said on Sunday.】

item.title: VinFast 在全球扩张的同时开设第二家国内电动汽车工厂
item.description: VinFast 已制定了在国际市场建立生产工厂的宏伟目标，但在全球扩张过程中面临着需求疲软和竞争激烈等障碍。【原文：VinFast has set ambitious goals to establish production plants in international markets, but has faced hurdles in its global expansion, including weaker demand and stiff competition.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，英伟达内部人士在市场大涨之际抛售逾 10 亿美元股票
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周日报道，英伟达公司内部人士在过去一年中抛售了价值超过 10 亿美元的公司股票，近期交易活动明显增加，原因是高管们利用了投资者对人工智能激增的兴趣。【原文：Nvidia insiders sold over $1 billion worth of company stock in the past year, with a notable uptick in recent trading activity as executives capitalize on surging investor interest in artificial intelligence, the Financial Times reported on Sunday.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克称参议院法案将破坏就业并损害美国利益
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周六批评了美国参议院公布的唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的最新版税收和支出法案，称其 "完全是疯狂和破坏性的"，几周前，这位全球最富有的人和全球最有权势的人结束了因马斯克反对该法案而引发的争吵。【原文：Billionaire Elon Musk on Saturday criticized the latest version of President Donald Trump's tax and spending bill released by the U.S. Senate, calling it "utterly insane and destructive," weeks after the world's richest person and its most powerful ended a feud sparked by Musk's opposition to the bill.】

item.title: Meta 再聘四名 OpenAI 研究人员，The Information 报道
item.description: 据 The Information 周六报道，Meta Platforms 正在招聘另外四名 OpenAI 人工智能研究人员。【原文：Meta Platforms is hiring four more OpenAI artificial intelligence researchers, The Information reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 即使市场反弹，特朗普的决策仍令市场焦虑不安
item.description: 随着华尔街将四月份的关税震荡纳入后视镜，股指创下历史新高，投资者对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的快速、有时甚至是混乱的决策过程仍然保持警惕，并认为反弹是脆弱的。【原文：As Wall Street puts April's tariff shakeout in the rearview mirror and indexes set record highs, investors remain wary of U.S. President Donald Trump's rapid-fire, sometimes chaotic policymaking process and see the rally as fragile.】

item.title: 美国司法部就 HPE 140 亿美元收购瞻博网络的反垄断案达成和解
item.description: 据法院文件显示，美国司法部已就质疑服务器制造商惠普企业公司（Hewlett Packard Enterprise）以 140 亿美元全现金收购瞻博网络（Juniper Networks）的诉讼达成和解。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice has settled its lawsuit challenging server maker Hewlett Packard Enterprise's all-cash acquisition of Juniper Networks for $14 billion, according to court filings.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，因气囊密封不当，Stellantis 将召回超过 25 万辆美国汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周六表示，由于侧帘式安全气囊密封不当，克莱斯勒母公司斯泰兰特将在美国召回250,651辆汽车。【原文：Chrysler parent Stellantis is recalling 250,651 vehicles in the U.S. due to an improperly sealed side curtain air bag, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Saturday.】

item.title: 巴菲特捐赠创纪录的 60 亿美元伯克希尔股票
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特周五又向盖茨基金会和四个家族慈善机构捐赠了 60 亿美元的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司股票，这是他近二十年前开始捐赠财产以来最大的一笔年度捐赠。【原文：Warren Buffett donated on Friday another $6 billion of Berkshire Hathaway stock to the Gates Foundation and four family charities, his biggest annual donation since he began giving away his fortune nearly two decades ago.】

item.title: 独家：英特尔最高战略官将于本月离职
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，英特尔最高战略主管 Safroadu Yeboah-Amankwah 即将离职，这是自今年 3 月陈立武执掌这家芯片制造商以来的最新变动。【原文：Intel's top strategy executive, Safroadu Yeboah-Amankwah, is departing the company, the latest change since Lip-Bu Tan took the chipmaker's helm in March, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 科技公司警告称 "分散蜘蛛 "黑客正瞄准航空业
item.description: 谷歌和 Palo Alto Networks 等科技公司对 "Scattered Spider "黑客组织对航空领域的兴趣敲响了警钟。【原文：Tech companies Google and Palo Alto Networks are sounding the alarm over the "Scattered Spider" hacking group's interest in the aviation sector.】

item.title: 特朗普称不会任命不支持降息的人进入美联储
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周五表示，他不会任命任何不会在现有基础上降低利率的人担任美联储主席，这或许是对下一任央行行长候选人进行的最明确的试金石测试，要求他们与他的大幅降息要求保持一致，以获得这份工作。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he would not appoint anyone to head the Federal Reserve who would not lower interest rates from where they are, setting perhaps the most explicit litmus test yet for candidates to be the next central bank chief to align with his demands for steep rate cuts in order to get the job.】

item.title: 瑞波公司首席执行官表示，将放弃在加密货币诉讼案中对美国证券交易委员会的交叉上诉
item.description: 加密货币公司瑞波实验室首席执行官周五表示，该公司将撤回对美国证券交易委员会的交叉上诉，这场旷日持久的法律战与其 XRP 代币的销售有关。【原文：Ripple Labs will withdraw its cross appeal against the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission in a prolonged legal battle tied to the sale of its XRP tokens, the crypto firm's CEO said on Friday.】

item.title: 加拿大钢铁生产商告诉政府其关税保护措施还不够
item.description: 加拿大钢铁业代表在本周的一次会议上告诉政府官员，他们为保护钢铁业免受美国关税影响而采取的措施是不够的。【原文：Canadian steel industry representatives told government officials in a meeting this week that their measures to protect the industry from the consequences of U.S. tariffs are insufficient, two of the representatives who attended the meeting told Reuters.】
